isense.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 //
00003 //      File Name:      isense.h
00004 //      Description:    Header File for InterSense library
00005 //      Created:        12/4/98
00006 //      Author:         Yury Altshuler
00007 //
00008 //      Copyright:      InterSense 2009 - All rights Reserved.
00009 //
00010 //      Comments:       This dynamic link library (DLL)/shared library is provided to simplify 
00011 //                      communications with all models of InterSense tracking devices. 
00012 //                      Currently, these include the InertiaCube series, other OEM sensors,
00013 //                                              the IS-900, IS-1200, and NavChip.  Older sensors including the IS-300,
00014 //                                              IS-600, and InterTrax are expected to work, but are no longer supported
00015 //                                              by InterSense. It can detect, configure, and get data from up to 8 trackers.
00016 //
00017 //                      The library provides two methods of configuring the Precision Series trackers.
00018 //                      You can use the provided function calls and hardcode the 
00019 //                      settings in your application, or use the isenseX.ini files. 
00020 //                      Second method is strongly recommended, as it provides you with the 
00021 //                      ability to change the configuration without recompiling your 
00022 //                      application.  In the isenseX.ini file name, X is a number, starting 
00023 //                      at 1, identifying the tracking system in the order of 
00024 //                      initialization. Use included the included isenseX.ini file as an example. 
00025 //                      Only enter the settings you want the program to change.
00026 //
00027 //                      The InterTrax (unsupported) requires no configuration. All function calls and 
00028 //                      settings in the isenseX.ini files are ignored.
00029 //
00030 //                       
00032 #ifndef _ISD_isenseh
00033 #define _ISD_isenseh
00034 
00035 #define ISLIB_VERSION "4.17"
00036 
00037 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__)
00038     #include <windows.h>
00039     #include "types.h"
00040 #else
00041     #include "types.h"
00042     #ifndef UNIX
00043         #define UNIX
00044     #endif
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #ifndef TRUE
00048     #define TRUE    1
00049     #define FALSE   0
00050 #endif

00053 //
00054 // This defines the calling conventions of the entry points to the
00055 // library. This varies depending upon the operating system.
00056 //
00058 
00059 #if defined _LIB // Static library
00060     #define     DLLEXPORT 
00061     #define     DLLENTRY __cdecl
00062     typedef void (* DLL_EP)(void);
00063     #define     DLL_EP_PTR __cdecl *
00064 #else
00065 
00066 #if defined UNDER_RTSS
00067     #define     DLLEXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
00068     #define     DLLENTRY _stdcall
00069     typedef void (* DLL_EP)(void);
00070     #define     DLL_EP_PTR _stdcall *
00071 #elif defined(_WIN32) || defined(WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__)
00072     #define     DLLEXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
00073     #define     DLLENTRY __cdecl
00074     typedef void (* DLL_EP)(void);
00075     #define     DLL_EP_PTR __cdecl *
00076 #else
00077     #define     DLLEXPORT
00078     #define     DLLENTRY
00079     typedef void (* DLL_EP)(void);
00080     #define     DLL_EP_PTR *
00081 #endif
00082 #endif

00093 // tracking system type
00094 typedef enum
00095 {
00096     ISD_NONE = 0,           // Not found, or unable to identify 
00097     ISD_PRECISION_SERIES,   // InertiaCubes, NavChip, IS-300, IS-600, IS-900 and IS-1200 
00098     ISD_INTERTRAX_SERIES    // InterTrax 
00099 }
00100 ISD_SYSTEM_TYPE;

00103 // tracking system model 
00104 typedef enum
00105 {
00106     ISD_UNKNOWN = 0,          
00107     ISD_IS300,          // 3DOF system (unsupported)
00108     ISD_IS600,          // 6DOF system (unsupported) 
00109     ISD_IS900,          // 6DOF system   
00110     ISD_INTERTRAX,      // InterTrax (Serial) (unsupported)
00111     ISD_INTERTRAX_2,    // InterTrax (USB) (unsupported)
00112     ISD_INTERTRAX_LS,   // InterTraxLS, verification required (unsupported)
00113     ISD_INTERTRAX_LC,   // InterTraxLC (unsupported)
00114     ISD_ICUBE2,         // InertiaCube2 
00115     ISD_ICUBE2_PRO,     // InertiaCube2 Pro 
00116     ISD_IS1200,         // 6DOF system   
00117     ISD_ICUBE3,         // InertiaCube3 
00118     ISD_NAVCHIP,        // NavChip
00119     ISD_INTERTRAX_3,    // InterTrax3 (unsupported)
00120     ISD_IMUK,           // K-Sensor 
00121     ISD_ICUBE2B_PRO,    // InertiaCube2B Pro 
00122     ISD_ICUBE2_PLUS     // InertiaCube2 Plus 
00123 }

00142 #if defined ISENSE_LIMITED
00143 #define ISD_MAX_TRACKERS        2       // Maximum stations (size of array for ISD_OpenAllTrackers()) 
00144 #define ISD_MAX_STATIONS        4       // Maximum stations (for IS-900, IS-1200)
00145 #else
00146 #define ISD_MAX_TRACKERS        32  // Maximum trackers (size of array for ISD_OpenAllTrackers())
00147 #define ISD_MAX_STATIONS        8       // Maximum stations (for IS-900, IS-1200)
00148 #endif

00150 // Orientation format (3DOF sensors report both regardless of setting; for IS-900, IS-1200)
00151 #define ISD_EULER               1
00152 #define ISD_QUATERNION          2
00153 
00154 // Coordinate frame in which position and orientation data is reported 
00155 #define ISD_DEFAULT_FRAME       1    // InterSense default 
00156 #define ISD_VSET_FRAME          2    // Virtual set frame, use for camera tracker only 
00157 
00158 // Number of supported stylus buttons 
00159 #define ISD_MAX_BUTTONS         8
00160 
00161 // Hardware is limited to 10 analog/digital input channels per station 
00162 #define ISD_MAX_CHANNELS        10
00163 
00164 // Maximum supported number of bytes for auxiliary input data
00165 #define ISD_MAX_AUX_INPUTS      4
00166 
00167 // Maximum supported number of bytes for auxiliary output data
00168 #define ISD_MAX_AUX_OUTPUTS     4

00175 typedef struct
00176 {
00177     // Following item are for information only and should not be changed 
00178     float  LibVersion;     // InterSense Library version 
00179 
00180     DWORD  TrackerType;    // IS Precision series or InterTrax. 
00181                            // TrackerType can be: 
00182                            // ISD_PRECISION_SERIES for InertiaCube, NavChip, IS-300, IS-600, IS-900 and IS-1200 model trackers, 
00183                            // ISD_INTERTRAX_SERIES for InterTrax, or 
00184                            // ISD_NONE if tracker is not initialized 
00185 
00186     DWORD  TrackerModel;   // ISD_UNKNOWN, ISD_IS300, ISD_IS600, ISD_IS900, ISD_INTERTRAX 
00187     
00188     DWORD  Port;           // Number of the RS232 port. Starts with 1 (COM1/ttyS0). 
00189 
00190     // Communications statistics, for information only. 
00191     DWORD  RecordsPerSec;
00192     float  KBitsPerSec;    
00193 
00194     // Following items are used to configure the tracker and can be set in
00195     // the isenseX.ini file 
00196 
00197     DWORD  SyncState;   // 4 states: 0 - OFF, system is in free run 
00198                         //           1 - ON, hardware genlock frequency is automatically determined
00199                         //           2 - ON, hardware genlock frequency is specified by the user
00200                         //           3 - ON, no hardware signal, lock to the user specified frequency  
00201 
00202     float  SyncRate;    // Sync frequency - number of hardware sync signals per second, 
00203                         // or, if SyncState is 3 - data record output frequency 
00204 
00205     DWORD  SyncPhase;   // 0 to 100%    
00206 
00207     DWORD  Interface;   // Hardware interface, read-only 
00208 
00209     DWORD  UltTimeout;  // IS-900 only, ultrasonic timeout (sampling rate)
00210     DWORD  UltVolume;   // IS-900 only, ultrasonic speaker volume
00211     DWORD  dwReserved4;
00212 
00213     float  FirmwareRev; // Firmware revision 
00214     float  fReserved2;
00215     float  fReserved3;
00216     float  fReserved4;
00217 
00218     Bool   LedEnable;   // IS-900 only, enables flasing blue LEDs on SoniStrips/SoniDiscs if TRUE
00219     Bool   bReserved2;
00220     Bool   bReserved3;
00221     Bool   bReserved4;
00222 }
00223 ISD_TRACKER_INFO_TYPE;

00229 // ISD_STATION_INFO_TYPE can only be used with IS Precision Series tracking devices.
00230 // If passed to ISD_SetStationConfig or ISD_GetStationConfig with InterTrax, FALSE is returned. 
00231 
00232 typedef struct
00233 {
00234     DWORD   ID;             // Unique number identifying a station. It is the same as that 
00235                             // passed to the ISD_SetStationConfig and ISD_GetStationConfig   
00236                             // functions and can be 1 to ISD_MAX_STATIONS 
00237 
00238     Bool    State;          // TRUE if ON, FALSE if OFF 
00239 
00240     Bool    Compass;        // 0 (OFF) or 2 (ON).  Setting 1 is no longer used and will
00241                             // have the same result as 2 (ON).
00242                             // Compass setting is ignored if station is configured for 
00243                             // Fusion Mode operation (such as an IS-900 tracker). 
00244 
00245     LONG    InertiaCube;    // InertiaCube associated with this station (IS-600). If no InertiaCube is
00246                             // assigned, this number is -1. Otherwise, it is a positive number
00247                             // 1 to 4 
00248 
00249     DWORD   Enhancement;    // Perceptual enhancement; levels 0, 1, or 2 
00250     DWORD   Sensitivity;    // Sensitivity; levels 1 to 4 (only used with Enhancement = 1 or 2) 
00251     DWORD   Prediction;     // 0 to 50 msec
00252     DWORD   AngleFormat;    // ISD_EULER or ISD_QUATERNION (only needed for IS-900, IS-1200)
00253    
00254     Bool    TimeStamped;    // TRUE if time stamp is requested 
00255     Bool    GetInputs;      // TRUE if button and joystick data is requested 
00256     Bool    GetEncoderData; // TRUE if raw encoder data is requested 
00257 
00258     // This setting controls how Magnetic Environment Calibration is applied. This calibration
00259     // calculates nominal field strength and dip angle for the environment in which the sensor
00260     // is used. Based on these values, the system can assign a weight to compass measurements,
00261     // allowing it to reject bad measurements. Values from 0 to 3 are accepted.
00262     //   If CompassCompensation is set to 0, the calibration is ignored and all compass data is
00263     // used. Higher values result in a tighter rejection threshold, resulting in more measurements 
00264     // being rejected. If the sensor is used in an environment with significant magnetic interference
00265     // this can result in drift due to insufficient compensation from the compass data. Default
00266     // setting is 2.
00267         //   Note that the sensor must be calibrated in the ISDemo Compass Calibration Tool for this 
00268         // setting to have any effect.
00269     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00270     BYTE    CompassCompensation;     
00271 
00272     // This setting controls how the system deals with sharp changes in IMU data that can
00273     // be caused by shock or impact. Sensors may experience momentary rotation rates or
00274     // accelerations that are outside of the specified range, resulting in undesirable 
00275     // behavior. By turning on shock suppression you can have the system filter out
00276     // corrupted data. Values 0 (OFF) to 2 are accepted, with higher values resulting in
00277     // greater filtering.
00278     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00279     BYTE    ImuShockSuppression;
00280 
00281     // This setting controls the rejection threshold for ultrasonic measurements. Currently, it is
00282     // implemented only for the IS-900 PCTracker. Default setting is 4, which results in measurements
00283     // with range errors greater than 4 times the average to be rejected. Please do not change
00284     // this setting without first consulting with InterSense technical support.
00285     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00286     BYTE    UrmRejectionFactor;
00287 
00288     BYTE    bReserved2;
00289 
00290     DWORD   CoordFrame;     // Coordinate frame in which position and orientation data is reported  
00291 
00292     // AccelSensitivity is used for 3-DOF tracking with InertiaCube products only. It controls how 
00293     // fast tilt correction, using accelerometers, is applied. Valid values are 1 to 4, with 2 as default. 
00294     //    Level 1 reduces the amount of tilt correction during movement. While it will prevent any effect  
00295     // linear accelerations may have on pitch and roll, it will also reduce stability and dynamic accuracy. 
00296     // It should only be used in situations when sensor is not expected to experience a lot of movement.
00297     //    Level 2 (default) is best for head tracking in static environment, with user seated. 
00298         //    Level 3 allows for more aggressive tilt compensation, appropriate when sensor is moved a lot, 
00299     // for example, when the user is walking for long periods of time. 
00300     //    Level 4 allows for even greater tilt corrections. It will reduce orientation accuracy by 
00301     // allowing linear accelerations to effect orientation, but increase stability. This level 
00302     // is appropriate for when the user is running, or in other situations where the sensor experiences 
00303     // a great deal of movement. 
00304     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00305     DWORD   AccelSensitivity; 
00306 
00307     DWORD   dwReserved3;    
00308     DWORD   dwReserved4;
00309 
00310     float   TipOffset[3];   // Coordinates in station frame (relative to tracker origin) of the point being tracked
00311     float   fReserved4;
00312 
00313     Bool    GetCameraData;  // TRUE to get computed FOV, aperture, etc  
00314     Bool    GetAuxInputs;     
00315     Bool    GetCovarianceData;
00316     Bool    GetExtendedData;
00317 }
00318 ISD_STATION_INFO_TYPE;
00319 
00320 
00322 
00323 typedef struct
00324 {
00325     BYTE    TrackingStatus;     // Tracking status, represents "Tracking Quality" (0-255; 0 if lost)
00326     BYTE    NewData;            // TRUE if data changed since last call to ISD_GetTrackingData       
00327     BYTE    CommIntegrity;      // Communication integrity (percentage of packets received from tracker, 0-255) 
00328     BYTE    BatteryState;       // Wireless devices only 0=N/A, 1=Low, 2=OK
00329 
00330     float   Euler[3];           // Orientation in Euler angle format (Yaw, Pitch, Roll)
00331     float   Quaternion[4];      // Orientation in Quaternion format (W,X,Y,Z)
00332     float   Position[3];        // Always in meters 
00333     float   TimeStamp;          // Timestamp in seconds, reported only if requested 
00334     float   StillTime;          // InertiaCube and PC-Tracker products only, whether sensor is still
00335     float   BatteryLevel;       // Battery voltage, if available
00336     float   CompassYaw;         // Magnetometer heading, computed based on current orientation.
00337                                 // Available for InertiaCube products only, such as IC2, IC3 and IC2+
00338 
00339     Bool    ButtonState[ISD_MAX_BUTTONS];    // Only if requested 
00340 
00341     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00342     // Current hardware is limited to 10 channels, with only 2 being used. 
00343     // The only device using this is the IS-900 wand that has a built-in
00344     // analog joystick. Channel 1 is X-axis rotation, channel 2 is Y-axis
00345     // rotation 
00346 
00347     short   AnalogData[ISD_MAX_CHANNELS]; // Only if requested 
00348 
00349     BYTE    AuxInputs[ISD_MAX_AUX_INPUTS];
00350 
00351 
00352     float   AngularVelBodyFrame[3]; // rad/sec, in sensor body coordinate frame. 
00353                                     // Reported as rates about X, Y and Z axes, corresponding
00354                                     // to Roll, Pitch, Yaw order.
00355                                     // This is the processed angular rate, with current biases 
00356                                     // removed. This is the angular rate used to produce 
00357                                     // orientation updates.
00358 
00359     float   AngularVelNavFrame[3];  // rad/sec, in world coordinate frame, with boresight and other
00360                                     // transformations applied. 
00361                                     // Reported as rates about X, Y and Z axes, corresponding
00362                                     // to Roll, Pitch, Yaw order.
00363     
00364     float   AccelBodyFrame[3];      // meter/sec^2, in sensor body coordinate frame. These are 
00365                                     // the accelerometer measurements in the sensor body coordinate 
00366                                     // frame. Only factory calibration is applied to this data, 
00367                                     // gravity component is not removed.    
00368                                     // Reported as accelerations along X, Y and Z axes.
00369 
00370     float   AccelNavFrame[3];       // meters/sec^2, in the navigation (earth) coordinate frame. 
00371                                     // This is the accelerometer measurements with calibration,  
00372                                     // current sensor orientation applied, and gravity  
00373                                     // subtracted. This is the best available estimate of
00374                                     // tracker acceleration.
00375                                     // Reported as accelerations along X, Y and Z axes.
00376 
00377     float   VelocityNavFrame[3];    // meters/sec, 6-DOF systems only.  
00378                                     // Reported as velocity along X, Y and Z axes.
00379 
00380     float   AngularVelRaw[3];       // Raw gyro output, only factory calibration is applied. 
00381                                     // Some errors due to temperature dependant gyro bias 
00382                                     // drift will remain.
00383 
00384     BYTE    MeasQuality;            // Ultrasonic Measurement Quality (IS-900 only, firmware >= 4.26)
00385     BYTE    bReserved2;
00386     BYTE    bReserved3;
00387     BYTE    bReserved4;
00388     
00389     DWORD   TimeStampSeconds;       // Time Stamp in whole seconds.
00390     DWORD   TimeStampMicroSec;      // Fractional part of the Time Stamp in micro-seconds.
00391 
00392     float   Reserved[61];
00393 }
00394 ISD_STATION_DATA_TYPE;

00399 typedef struct
00400 {
00401     BYTE    TrackingStatus;     // Tracking status byte 
00402     BYTE    bReserved1;         // Pack to 4 byte boundary 
00403     BYTE    bReserved2;
00404     BYTE    bReserved3;
00405 
00406     DWORD   Timecode;           // Timecode, not implemented yet 
00407     LONG    ApertureEncoder;    // Aperture encoder counts, relative to last reset or power up 
00408     LONG    FocusEncoder;       // Focus encoder counts 
00409     LONG    ZoomEncoder;        // Zoom encoded counts 
00410     DWORD   TimecodeUserBits;   // Time code user bits, not implemented yet 
00411 
00412     float   Aperture;           // Computed aperture value 
00413     float   Focus;              // Computed focus value (mm), not implemented yet 
00414     float   FOV;                // Computed vertical FOV value (degrees) 
00415     float   NodalPoint;         // Nodal point offset due to zoom and focus (mm) 
00416 
00417     float   CovarianceOrientation[3];     // Available only for IS-1200
00418     float   CovariancePosition[3];
00419 
00420     DWORD   dwReserved1;
00421     DWORD   dwReserved2;
00422 
00423     float   fReserved1;
00424     float   fReserved2;
00425     float   fReserved3;
00426     float   fReserved4;
00427 }

00471     struct
00472     {

00490         DWORD   MaxChannels;  // Maximum number of analog channels supported per station
00491         DWORD   MaxButtons;   // Maximum number of digital button inputs per station
00492 
00493         Bool    MeasData;     // Can provide measurement data

00495         Bool    PseConfig;    // Supports PSE configuration/reporting tools
00496         Bool    ConfigLock;   // Supports configuration locking

00507

00509         DWORD   dwReserved2;       
00510         DWORD   dwReserved3;     
00511         DWORD   dwReserved4;
00512     }

00514

00516     Bool    bReserved2;

00540 // Station hardware information.
00541 // This structure provides detailed information on station hardware and
00542 // its capabilities.
00543 
00544 typedef struct
00545 {
00546     Bool    Valid;             // Set to TRUE if ISD_GetStationHardwareInfo succeeded
00547 
00548     DWORD   ID;                // Unique number identifying a station. It is the same as that 
00549                                // passed to the ISD_SetStationConfig and ISD_GetStationConfig   
00550                                // functions and can be 1 to ISD_MAX_STATIONS 
00551 
00552     char    DescVersion[20];   // Station Descriptor version 
00553 
00554     float   FirmwareRev;       // Station firmware revision
00555     DWORD   SerialNum;         // Station serial number 
00556     char    CalDate[20];       // Last factory calibration date (mm/dd/yyyy)
00557     DWORD   Port;              // Hardware port number 
00558     
00559     struct
00560     {
00561         Bool    Position;      // TRUE if station can track position
00562         Bool    Orientation;   // TRUE if station can track orientation
00563         DWORD   Encoders;      // Number of lens encoders, if 0 then none are available
00564         DWORD   NumChannels;   // Number of analog channels supported by this station, wand has 2 (joystick axes)
00565         DWORD   NumButtons;    // Number of digital button inputs supported by this station
00566         DWORD   AuxInputs;     // Number of auxiliary input channels (OEM products)
00567         DWORD   AuxOutputs;    // Number of auxiliary output channels (OEM products)
00568         Bool    Compass;       // TRUE if station has a compass
00569 
00570         Bool    bReserved1;     
00571         Bool    bReserved2;
00572         Bool    bReserved3;     
00573         Bool    bReserved4;
00574 
00575         DWORD   dwReserved1;        
00576         DWORD   dwReserved2;       
00577         DWORD   dwReserved3;     
00578         DWORD   dwReserved4;
00579     }
00580     Capability;
00581 
00582     Bool    bReserved1;
00583     Bool    bReserved2;
00584     Bool    bReserved3;     
00585     Bool    bReserved4;
00586 
00587     DWORD   Type;           // Station type        
00588     DWORD   DeviceID;       
00589     DWORD   dwReserved3;     
00590     DWORD   dwReserved4;
00591

00605 // Returns -1 on failure. To detect one tracker automatically, specify 0 for commPort.
00606 // hParent parameter to ISD_OpenTracker is optional and should only be used if 
00607 // information screen or tracker configuration tools are to be used when available 
00608 // in a future releases. If you would like a tracker initialization window to be 
00609 // displayed, specify TRUE for the infoScreen parameter (not implemented in
00610 // this release).  Call multiple times to detect multiple trackers (but also please
00611 // see comments for ISD_OpenAllTrackers below).  
00612 //   Note that wireless 3DOF sensors such as the wireless IC3 are considered trackers,
00613 // not stations (even if using a shared receiver), so each tracker must have a 
00614 // separate handle associated with it.  A station is a concept associated with the 
00615 // IS-900 and IS-1200 systems.
00616 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00617 DLLEXPORT ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE DLLENTRY ISD_OpenTracker( 
00618                                                       Hwnd hParent, 
00619                                                       DWORD commPort, 
00620                                                       Bool infoScreen, 
00621                                                       Bool verbose 
00622                                                       );
00623 
00624 // Returns -1 on failure.  This is the recommended method for opening multiple 
00625 // trackers.  The handle pointer will be populated with handles for all detected
00626 // trackers, and should point to an ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE array of size ISD_MAX_TRACKERS
00627 DLLEXPORT DWORD DLLENTRY ISD_OpenAllTrackers( 
00628                                              Hwnd hParent, 
00629                                              ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE *handle, 
00630                                              Bool infoScreen, 
00631                                              Bool verbose 
00632                                              );
00633 
00634 // This function call uninitializes a tracker, closes communications port and 
00635 // frees the resources associated with the tracker handle. If 0 is passed, all currently
00636 // open trackers are closed. When the last tracker is closed, program frees the library. 
00637 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00638 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_CloseTracker( ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle );

00673 // Configure station as specified in the ISD_STATION_INFO_TYPE structure. Before

00685 
00686 // Fills the ISD_STATION_INFO_TYPE structure with current settings. Function
00687 // requests configuration records from the tracker and waits for the response.
00688 // If communications are interrupted, it will stall for several seconds while 
00689 // attempting to recover the settings. Should only be used with IS Precision Series 
00690 // tracking devices, not valid for InterTrax.
00691 // stationID is a number from 1 to ISD_MAX_STATIONS 
00692 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00693 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_GetStationConfig(
00694                                              ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00695                                              ISD_STATION_INFO_TYPE *Station,
00696                                              WORD stationID, 
00697                                              Bool verbose 
00698                                              );
00699 
00700 // When a tracker is first opened, library automatically looks for a configuration
00701 // file in current directory of the application. File name convention is
00702 // isenseX.ini where X is a number, starting at 1, identifying the first tracking 
00703 // system in the order of initialization. This function provides for a way to
00704 // manually configure the tracker using an arbitrary configuration file instead.
00705 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00706 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_ConfigureFromFile(
00707                                      ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00708                                      char *path, 
00709                                      Bool verbose 
00710                                      );

00713 // Save tracker configuration. For devices with on-host processing,
00714 // like the IS-900 PCTracker, this will write to the isenseX.cfg file. 
00715 // Serial port devices like IS-300, IS-600 and IS-900 save configuration 
00716 // in the base unit, and this call will just send a command to commit the
00717 // changes to permanent storage.
00718 
00719 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_ConfigSave( ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle );

00732 // in the ISD_CAMERA_DATA_TYPE structure. This function does not service the serial 
00733 // port, so ISD_GetTrackingData must be called prior to this. 
00734 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

00739 
00740 
00741 // By default, ISD_GetTrackingData processes all records available from the tracker
00742 // and only returns the latest data. As the result, data samples can be lost.
00743 // If all the data samples are required, you can use a ring buffer to store them.
00744 // ISD_SetupRingBuffer accepts a pointer to the ring buffer, and its size.
00745 // Once activated, all processed data samples are stored in the buffer for use
00746 // by the application. 
00747 //
00748 // ISD_GetTrackingData can still be used to read the data, but will return the
00749 // oldest saved data sample, then remove it from the buffer (first in - first out). 
00750 // By repeatedly calling ISD_GetTrackingData, all samples are retrieved, the latest
00751 // coming last. All consecutive calls to ISD_GetTrackingData will return the last
00752 // sample, but the NewData flag will be FALSE to indicate that the buffer has
00753 // been emptied.
00754 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00755 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_RingBufferSetup( 
00756                                    ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00757                                    WORD stationID, 
00758                                    ISD_STATION_DATA_TYPE *dataBuffer, 
00759                                    DWORD samples 
00760                                    );
00761 
00762 // Activate the ring buffer. While active, all data samples are stored in the 
00763 // buffer. Because this is a ring buffer, it will only store the number of samples
00764 // specified in the call to ISD_SetupRingBuffer, so the oldest samples can be 
00765 // overwritten.
00766 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00767 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_RingBufferStart(
00768                                    ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle,
00769                                    WORD stationID
00770                                    );
00771 
00772 // Stop collection. The library will continue to process data, but the contents of
00773 // the ring buffer will not be altered.
00774 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00775 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_RingBufferStop(
00776                                   ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle,
00777                                   WORD stationID
00778                                   );
00779 
00780 
00781 // Queries the library for the latest data without removing it from the buffer or 
00782 // affecting the NewData flag. It also returns the indexes of the newest and the
00783 // oldest samples in the buffer. These can then be used to parse the buffer.
00784 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00785 DLLEXPORT Bool ISD_RingBufferQuery( 
00786                                    ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00787                                    WORD stationID,
00788                                    ISD_STATION_DATA_TYPE *currentData,
00789                                    DWORD *head,
00790                                    DWORD *tail
00791                                    );

00797                                          WORD stationID 
00798                                          );

00800 
00801 // Works with all IS-X00 series products, InterTraxLC and InertiaCube products.
00802 // For InterTrax30 and InterTrax2, it behaves like ISD_ResetHeading.
00803 // Boresight a station using specific reference angles. This is useful when
00804 // you need to apply a specific offset to system output. For example, if
00805 // a sensor is mounted at 40 degrees pitch relative to an HMD, you can 
00806 // pass in 0, 40, 0 to make the system output (0,0,0) when the HMD is horizontal.
00807 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00808 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_BoresightReferenced( 
00809                                                 ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00810                                                 WORD stationID, 
00811                                                 float yaw,
00812                                                 float pitch, 
00813                                                 float roll 
00814                                                 );
00815 
00816 // Works with all IS-X00 series products, InterTraxLC and InertiaCube products.
00817 // For InterTrax30 and InterTrax2, it behaves like ISD_ResetHeading.
00818 // Boresight or unboresight a station. If 'set' is TRUE, all angles
00819 // are reset to zero. Otherwise, all boresight settings are cleared,
00820 // including those set by ISD_ResetHeading and ISD_BoresightReferenced.
00821 //   Note that the angles are reset relative to the current yaw; if the station
00822 // is at 90 degrees yaw and 0 degrees pitch/roll when this function is called, 
00823 // rolling the sensor (relative to its current heading) will be considered pitch,
00824 // and pitch (relative to its current heading) will be considered roll; it does
00825 // not perform a boresight 'relative' to the current orientation vector.
00826 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00827 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_Boresight( 
00828                                       ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00829                                       WORD stationID,
00830                                       Bool set
00831                                       );
00832 
00833 
00834 
00835 // Send a configuration script to the tracker. Script must consist of valid 
00836 // commands as described in the interface protocol. Commands in the script 
00837 // should be terminated by the newline character '\n'.  The linefeed character '\r' 
00838 // is added by the function, and is not required. 
00839 //   Note that this may not be supported when using the shared memory interface,
00840 // such as with sfServer, and is primarily intended for the IS-300/IS-600/IS-900 system.
00841 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00842 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_SendScript( 
00843                                        ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00844                                        char *script 
00845                                        );
00846 
00847 
00848 // Sends up to 4 output bytes to the auxiliary interface of the station  
00849 // specified. The number of bytes should match the number the auxiliary outputs
00850 // the interface is configured to expect. If too many are specified, extra bytes 
00851 // are ignored. 
00852 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00853 DLLEXPORT Bool DLLENTRY ISD_AuxOutput( 
00854                                        ISD_TRACKER_HANDLE handle, 
00855                                        WORD stationID,
00856                                        BYTE *AuxOutput, 
00857                                        WORD length 
00858                                        );
